title: NaOH-HCl titration curve - curve with 1.0 M HCl

content.question: One student titrated the NaOH(aq) with 1.0 M HCl(aq) instead of 0.10 M HCl(aq). How would the studentâ€™s titration curve differ from the original curve?

choices.label: The initial pH would be 11 instead of 13.
The pH at the equivalence point would be 5 instead of 7.
The pH far beyond the equivalence point would be higher than in the original curve.
The pH far beyond the equivalence point would be lower than in the original curve.

content.answer: The pH far beyond the equivalence point would be lower than in the original curve.

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
